Author: swirlturls
Text: yeah thank you for reminding me and bringing me back to reality! you are totally right and i remember back when i was 16-18 i struggled so much with weight i was so into manga and anime and i didnt have any friends so i would fixate on *fictional characters* bodies and beat myself up over not being like them. i came to know they're unrealistic but sometimes i read and im like.....wow.....i need to match those standards. it's stupid LOL.

Author: brimstonealchemist
Text: Most thin manga characters seem to have made-up measurements of Z-cup boobs and 2 nanometer waists. The manga artists probably don't know the measurements of any real life person, and just look at what measurements pre-existing manga characters have, and add a bunch of inches to then when creating an overweight character. This results in average measurements, because the baseline is so unrealistic.   I hate it when measurements or weights are mentioned in fiction and they're completely unrealistic. I think people should bother to spend the 1 minute it takes to google what measurements a character could really have if they want to say the character's official measurements.
